author: nori
msg: * STATUS
r20248): Nominate and vote.

author: dlr
msg: On the merge-tracking branch: Improve doc string.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(calculate_merge_ranges): Change doc string description.

author: dlr
msg: On the merge-tracking branch: Begin teaching the 'merge' logic to
deal with merge info, to avoid the "repeated merge" problem which
arises when merging revision ranges which contain revisions that have
already been cherry picked from the merge source.
This is an incremental commit (a work-in-progress).  Single-file
merges are not yet handled, and most black box tests still need to be
updated to account for the housekeeping property set in the WC by
merge tracking.
* subversion/libsvn_client/diff.c
(parse_merge_info): Add a new function to parse any merge info from
WCPATH and store it in MERGEINFO.  If no merge info is available,
set MERGEINFO to an empty hash.
(calculate_merge_ranges): Add a new function to calculate the target
rangelist by subtracting revisions which have already been merged
from the requested range, and storing what's left in REMAINING_RANGES.
(do_merge): Enhance logic to take into account that revisions from
the requested range which have already been merged may create holes
in range to merge.  Loop over the revision ranges we have left to
merge, getting an editor for each range, and applying its delta.
When not in dry run mode, record changes to the merge info in the WC.
(do_single_file_merge): Noted TODO about the need to handle merge
tracking a la do_merge() (as both functions are invoked by
svn_client_merge2() and svn_client_merge_peg2()).
* subversion/tests/cmdline/merge_tests.py
(SVN_PROP_MERGE_INFO): A constant for the "svn:mergeinfo" property.
(textual_merges_galore): Account for the housekeeping property set
by merge tracking, allowing test 1 to pass with the corresponding
changes to diff.c.
